column4: updates brought a new kernel, and my non-free nvidia drivers need to be reinstalled
I'm in a console. if I try to stop gdm it says:  unknown instance, but nvidia drivers say there's X running and I should stop
I tried the init.d script, no way to stop gdm
ok chmod -x done
then?
still, stop:unknown instance
but they don't like that there's X running already, and I cannot stop gdm
I'm following tutorials, but gdm: unknown service is stopping me
If applying recommended updates (new kernel) will kill your guI for good and getting it back requires command line work, we are far from reaching mainstream desktop users...
how do I force shutdown X?
why?
why do you want to shut down X...
you're likely doing something the hard way.  Tell us what you want to accomplish
are you using the drivers provided by ubuntu in System -> Hardware Drivers?
the ones in Hardware Drivers are also the non-free ones.
if you use the Hardware Drivers ones then you won't have the issue you are currently having
ok, but how do I get back to normal?
then use System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers ?
so?
because you aren't using the drivers from ubuntu
yes
no mucking about with xorg.conf
depending on what you've done so far though, you may have to undo that
